Topic.Title: unable to play any games on desktop version of Quest

Posts.EditableText:
I have updated to the latest version of Quest and I am running Windows 10. Every time I click the play button when creating a game I get the error:
[b:2fo2mr4x]Error launching game: Could not load file or assembly 'CefSharp.Core.dll' or one of its dependencies. The specified module could not be found.[/b:2fo2mr4x]
I have uninstalled and reinstalled Quest but to no avail. I have also reinstalled 5.6.0 and the same issue appeared.
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText: I ran into the exact same problem on a computer running Windows XP, but going back to the older version corrected it. I have no idea why you'd be having this issue with Windows 10 though.
Posts.HTML: I ran into the exact same problem on a computer running Windows XP, but going back to the older version corrected it. I have no idea why you'd be having this issue with Windows 10 though.

Posts.EditableText: It seems that installing 5.5.1 fixed it. I upgraded to Windows 10 from Windows 8 and on Windows 8 Quest 5.6.0 worked but not after upgrading to Windows 10.
Posts.HTML: It seems that installing 5.5.1 fixed it. I upgraded to Windows 10 from Windows 8 and on Windows 8 Quest 5.6.0 worked but not after upgrading to Windows 10.

Posts.EditableText:
[quote="psychospark":32k3nowx]It seems that installing 5.5.1 fixed it. [/quote:32k3nowx]
When I decided to start using Quest again, I downloaded the latest version, but like yourself I had to revert back to 5.5.1

However, I'm still on XP, so it's not surprising I encountered issues. Like Marzipan says, though, can't think why there'd be any problems running it on W10
